unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Reducing the Probability of a Type I Error
question_text: For a summer internship with a statistical consulting company, Alison proposed conducting a one-sided (greater than) significance test at the $\alpha = 0.05$ level.  Her supervisor suggested that she try to reduce her probability of making a type I error.  If Alison does adjust her significance test so that the possibility of a type I error is reduced, which of the following will also happen?  Assume that Alison will still be conducting a one-sided test with the same sample size. I. The significance level of the test will be increased. II. The probability of making a type II error will be increased. III. The power of the test will be decreased.
